decks.notes: This UR Aggro deck focuses on using cheap, aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Dragon's Rage Channeler, along with powerful support spells like Lightning Bolt and Force of Will, to quickly apply pressure to the opponent. The deck aims to control the board through counter magic and removal while maintaining a fast clock with evasive threats. With a mix of card advantage, tempo plays, and versatile interaction, this deck seeks to overwhelm the opponent early in the game and maintain momentum throughout.

This deck utilizes the combo of Cephalid Illusionist, Nomads en-Kor, and a card like Shuko or Kaldra Compleat to mill the entire library, while also generating a large number of Narcomoebas. Thassa's Oracle is used as the win condition to win the game if the library is empty. The deck includes various cantrip cards like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Teferi, Time Raveler to find the combo pieces quickly. It also includes disruption cards like Force of Will, Daze, and Cabal Therapy to interact with the opponent's gameplan. Urza's Saga is included to tutor for key combo pieces.

The key concept of this deck is to establish early board presence and disrupt the opponent's game plan by utilizing powerful hatebears like Archon of Emeria and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben. The deck also aims to control the game with removal spells like Swords to Plowshares while generating card advantage and value through Seasoned Dungeoneer and White Plume Adventurer. Additionally, the deck includes disruptive artifacts such as Chalice of the Void and Null Rod to hinder the opponent's strategies. The deck's mana base is designed to support its aggressive game plan with a combination of efficient mana sources and powerful utility lands like Karakas.

The key concept of this deck is to use the combo between Painter's Servant and Grindstone to mill the opponent's library, while controlling the board with disruption spells like Pyroblast and Red Elemental Blast. The deck also utilizes Goblin Welder and Goblin Engineer to help tutor and recur key artifacts like Grindstone and Urza's Saga. It aims to have a fast and aggressive start with cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Lotus Petal, while also having resilience through cards like Breya's Apprentice and Soul-Guide Lantern. The deck's main game plan is to quickly assemble the combo and win the game through mill.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through counterspells and removal spells, while also utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Jace and Teferi to generate card advantage and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to control the board and the opponent's resources through a combination of countermagic, removal, and card draw, ultimately aiming to out-value the opponent and win through incremental advantage. The inclusion of cards like Shark Typhoon and Dress Down provide additional versatility and disruption options to help navigate different matchups effectively.

This Legacy 1 vs 1 deck revolves around aggressive and proactive gameplay. It aims to establish board presence quickly and maintain control through disruption and high-power creatures. The deck utilizes lands like Ancient Tomb, Cavern of Souls, and City of Traitors to generate mana efficiently. Key creatures like White Plume Adventurer, Archon of Emeria, and Caves of Chaos Adventurer provide both offense and defense. Seasoned Dungeoneer allows for card draw and Anointed Peacekeeper slows down the opponent's aggression. The deck also includes disruption elements like Karakas and Palace Jailer to disrupt the opponent's strategy.

The key concept of this deck is to aggressively establish board presence and maintain initiative through the use of efficient creatures like White Plume Adventurer, Simian Spirit Guide, and Goblin Rabblemaster. The deck also aims to disrupt the opponent's plays with cards like Fury and Chalice of the Void. Additionally, it utilizes card draw and filtering through Seasoned Dungeoneer and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker to maintain consistency. The deck incorporates some land disruption with Caves of Chaos Adventurer and Karakas. Shatterskull Smashing and Comet, Stellar Pup provide additional sources of direct damage to close out games.

The deck aims to quickly assemble the necessary cards to cast Doomsday, a powerful combo card that allows the player to stack their deck in a specific way to win the game on the spot with Thassa's Oracle. By utilizing cards like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Preordain to set up the perfect Doomsday pile, as well as protection like Force of Will and Teferi, Time Raveler to ensure the combo goes off uninterrupted, the deck seeks to win in a swift and efficient manner while controlling the game with disruptive cards like Daze and Baleful Strix.
